org.reprap
Interface Printer

All Known Subinterfaces:
CartesianPrinter, PolarPrinter
All Known Implementing Classes:
GCodeRepRap, GenericRepRap, Simulator
public interface Printer

moveTo

void moveTo(double x,
            double y,
            double z,
            double feedrate,
            boolean startUp,
            boolean endUp)
            throws ReprapException,
                   java.io.IOException
Move the printer carriage to the give x, y and z position while extruding material

Parameters:
x - absolute x position in millimeters relative to the home position. Range between [0..???]
y - absolute y position in millimters relative to the home position. Range betwen [0..???]
z - absolute z position in millimters relative to the home position. Range between [0..???]
startUp - ?
endUp - ?
Throws:
ReprapException
java.io.IOException

printTo

void printTo(double x,
             double y,
             double z,
             double feedrate,
             boolean stopExtruder,
             boolean closeValve)
             throws ReprapException,
                    java.io.IOException
Move the printer carriage to the give x, y and z position while extruding material

Parameters:
x - absolute x position in millimeters relative to the home position. Range between [0..???]
y - absolute y position in millimters relative to the home position. Range betwen [0..???]
z - absolute z position in millimters relative to the home position. Range between [0..???]
lastOne - True if extruder should be turned off at end of this segment.
Throws:
ReprapException
java.io.IOException

setZManual

void setZManual(double zeroPoint)
                throws java.io.IOException
Allow the user to manually calibrate the Z axis position to deal with special circumstances like different extruder sizes, platform additions or subtractive fabrication.

Parameters:
zeroPoint - The point the user selects will be treated as the given Z value rather than 0.0
Throws:
java.io.IOException

waitWhileBufferNotEmpty

void waitWhileBufferNotEmpty()
If we are using an output buffer, it's a good idea to wait till it's empty between layers before computing the next one.

slowBuffer

void slowBuffer()
It's also useful to be able to change its priority

speedBuffer

void speedBuffer()

machineWait

void machineWait(double milliseconds,
                 boolean fastExtrude)
All machine dwells and delays are routed via this function, rather than calling Thread.sleep - this allows them to generate the right G codes (G4) etc. The RS232/USB etc comms system doesn't use this - it sets its own delays.

Parameters:
milliseconds -

addSTLFileForMaking

java.lang.String addSTLFileForMaking()
Load a file to be made. Currently these can be STLs (more than one can be loaded) or a GCode file, or an .rfo file.

Returns:
the name of the file

boolean filePlay()

void pause()

setBedTemperature

void setBedTemperature(double temperature)
Set the bed temperature. This value is given in centigrade, i.e. 100 equals 100 centigrade.

Parameters:
temperature - The temperature of the extruder in centigrade
wait - - wait till it gets there (or not).
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getBedTemperature

double getBedTemperature()
Return the current temperature of the bed

Returns:

getBedTemperatureTarget

double getBedTemperatureTarget()
The temperature we want the bed to be at

Returns:

stabilise

void stabilise()
Wait till the entire machine is ready to print. That is that such things as extruder and bed temperatures are at the values set and stable.
